title: Photoelectric - why freq is not 0 when Kmax is 0

content.question: The graph represents the maximum kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math> of emitted electrons as a function of the frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> of light that is incident on the surface from which the electrons are emitted. Which of the following is a justification for why the line does not pass through the origin?

choices.label: For light below a certain frequency, an individual photon has insufficient energy to remove an electron from the surface.
As the frequency of the incident light approaches zero, the kinetic energy of emitted electrons approaches a specific negative value.
The slope of the graph is nonzero but negligible at low frequencies, and then becomes equal to Planckâ€™s constant above a certain frequency.
As the light frequency increases from zero, the work function of the surface increases from zero to a value that is constant for frequencies above a certain value.

content.answer: For light below a certain frequency, an individual photon has insufficient energy to remove an electron from the surface.
